verses.kjv: And the LORD spake unto Moses, Go unto Pharaoh, and say unto him, Thus saith the LORD, Let my people go, that they may serve me.
verses.ct: The LORD told Moses, "Go to Pharaoh and tell him: This is what the LORD says — Release my people so they can worship me.

verses.kjv: And if thou refuse to let them go, behold, I will smite all thy borders with frogs:
verses.ct: If you refuse to release them, pay attention — I will strike your entire country with frogs.

verses.kjv: And the river shall bring forth frogs abundantly, which shall go up and come into thine house, and into thy bedchamber, and upon thy bed, and into the house of thy servants, and upon thy people, and into thine ovens, and into thy kneadingtroughs:
verses.ct: The Nile will swarm with frogs, and they will crawl up into your palace, into your bedroom, onto your bed, into the homes of your officials, all over your people, into your ovens, and into your bread bowls.

verses.kjv: And the frogs shall come up both on thee, and upon thy people, and upon all thy servants.
verses.ct: The frogs will climb all over you, your people, and all your officials."

verses.kjv: And the LORD spake unto Moses, Say unto Aaron, Stretch forth thine hand with thy rod over the streams, over the rivers, and over the ponds, and cause frogs to come up upon the land of Egypt.
verses.ct: Then the LORD told Moses, "Tell Aaron to extend his hand with his staff over the streams, rivers, and ponds, and bring frogs up across the land of Egypt."

verses.kjv: And Aaron stretched out his hand over the waters of Egypt; and the frogs came up, and covered the land of Egypt.
verses.ct: So Aaron extended his hand over the waters of Egypt, and frogs came up and covered the entire land of Egypt.

verses.kjv: And the magicians did so with their enchantments, and brought up frogs upon the land of Egypt.
verses.ct: The magicians used their secret arts to do the same thing, bringing frogs up onto the land of Egypt.

verses.kjv: Then Pharaoh called for Moses and Aaron, and said, Intreat the LORD, that he may take away the frogs from me, and from my people; and I will let the people go, that they may do sacrifice unto the LORD.
verses.ct: Pharaoh summoned Moses and Aaron and said, "Pray to the LORD to take these frogs away from me and my people, and I will release the people to offer sacrifices to the LORD."

verses.kjv: And Moses said unto Pharaoh, Glory over me: when shall I intreat for thee, and for thy servants, and for thy people, to destroy the frogs from thee and thy houses, that they may remain in the river only?
verses.ct: Moses said to Pharaoh, "You have the honor of choosing — when should I pray for you, your officials, and your people to have the frogs removed from you and your homes, so that they remain only in the Nile?"

verses.kjv: And he said, To morrow. And he said, Be it according to thy word: that thou mayest know that there is none like unto the LORD our God.
verses.ct: Pharaoh answered, "Tomorrow." Moses replied, "It will be just as you say, so that you will know there is no one like the LORD our God.

verses.kjv: And the frogs shall depart from thee, and from thy houses, and from thy servants, and from thy people; they shall remain in the river only.
verses.ct: The frogs will leave you, your homes, your officials, and your people. They will remain only in the Nile."

verses.kjv: And Moses and Aaron went out from Pharaoh: and Moses cried unto the LORD because of the frogs which he had brought against Pharaoh.
verses.ct: Moses and Aaron left Pharaoh's presence, and Moses called out to the LORD about the frogs he had brought against Pharaoh.

verses.kjv: And the LORD did according to the word of Moses; and the frogs died out of the houses, out of the villages, and out of the fields.
verses.ct: The LORD did what Moses asked — the frogs died in the houses, in the villages, and in the fields.

verses.kjv: And they gathered them together upon heaps: and the land stank.
verses.ct: The people piled them up in huge heaps, and the whole land reeked.

verses.kjv: But when Pharaoh saw that there was respite, he hardened his heart, and hearkened not unto them; as the LORD had said.
verses.ct: But when Pharaoh saw that the crisis was over, he hardened his heart and refused to listen to them, just as the LORD had predicted.

verses.kjv: And the LORD said unto Moses, Say unto Aaron, Stretch out thy rod, and smite the dust of the land, that it may become lice throughout all the land of Egypt.
verses.ct: The LORD told Moses, "Tell Aaron to extend his staff and strike the dust on the ground, so that it turns into gnats throughout all of Egypt."

verses.kjv: And they did so; for Aaron stretched out his hand with his rod, and smote the dust of the earth, and it became lice in man, and in beast; all the dust of the land became lice throughout all the land of Egypt.
verses.ct: They did this — Aaron extended his hand with his staff and struck the dust on the ground, and gnats appeared on people and animals. All the dust across Egypt turned into gnats.

verses.kjv: And the magicians did so with their enchantments to bring forth lice, but they could not: so there were lice upon man, and upon beast.
verses.ct: The magicians tried to produce gnats using their secret arts, but they couldn't do it. The gnats remained on people and animals everywhere.

verses.kjv: Then the magicians said unto Pharaoh, This is the finger of God: and Pharaoh’s heart was hardened, and he hearkened not unto them; as the LORD had said.
verses.ct: The magicians told Pharaoh, "This is the power of God." But Pharaoh's heart remained hard, and he refused to listen to them, just as the LORD had predicted.

verses.kjv: And the LORD said unto Moses, Rise up early in the morning, and stand before Pharaoh; lo, he cometh forth to the water; and say unto him, Thus saith the LORD, Let my people go, that they may serve me.
verses.ct: The LORD told Moses, "Get up early in the morning and confront Pharaoh as he goes down to the water. Tell him: This is what the LORD says — Release my people so they can worship me.

verses.kjv: Else, if thou wilt not let my people go, behold, I will send swarms of flies upon thee, and upon thy servants, and upon thy people, and into thy houses: and the houses of the Egyptians shall be full of swarms of flies, and also the ground whereon they are.
verses.ct: If you will not release my people, I will send massive swarms of flies on you, your officials, your people, and into your homes. The houses of the Egyptians will be filled with swarms of flies, and even the ground they walk on will be covered.

verses.kjv: And I will sever in that day the land of Goshen, in which my people dwell, that no swarms of flies shall be there; to the end thou mayest know that I am the LORD in the midst of the earth.
verses.ct: But on that day I will treat the region of Goshen differently — where my people live — so that no swarms of flies will be there. This way you will know that I, the LORD, am at work in this land.

verses.kjv: And I will put a division between my people and thy people: to morrow shall this sign be.
verses.ct: I will make a clear distinction between my people and your people. This sign will happen tomorrow."

verses.kjv: And the LORD did so; and there came a grievous swarm of flies into the house of Pharaoh, and into his servants’ houses, and into all the land of Egypt: the land was corrupted by reason of the swarm of flies.
verses.ct: The LORD did exactly that. Terrible swarms of flies invaded Pharaoh's palace, the homes of his officials, and the entire land of Egypt. The country was devastated by the flies.

verses.kjv: And Pharaoh called for Moses and for Aaron, and said, Go ye, sacrifice to your God in the land.
verses.ct: Pharaoh summoned Moses and Aaron and said, "Go ahead and sacrifice to your God, but do it here in this land."

verses.kjv: And Moses said, It is not meet so to do; for we shall sacrifice the abomination of the Egyptians to the LORD our God: lo, shall we sacrifice the abomination of the Egyptians before their eyes, and will they not stone us?
verses.ct: Moses replied, "That wouldn't be right, because the animals we sacrifice to the LORD our God are considered sacred by the Egyptians. If we sacrifice animals that the Egyptians consider sacred right in front of them, won't they stone us?

verses.kjv: We will go three days’ journey into the wilderness, and sacrifice to the LORD our God, as he shall command us.
verses.ct: We need to travel 3 days into the wilderness and sacrifice to the LORD our God, just as he commands us."

verses.kjv: And Pharaoh said, I will let you go, that ye may sacrifice to the LORD your God in the wilderness; only ye shall not go very far away: intreat for me.
verses.ct: Pharaoh said, "I'll let you go to sacrifice to the LORD your God in the wilderness, but don't go too far. And pray for me."

verses.kjv: And Moses said, Behold, I go out from thee, and I will intreat the LORD that the swarms of flies may depart from Pharaoh, from his servants, and from his people, to morrow: but let not Pharaoh deal deceitfully any more in not letting the people go to sacrifice to the LORD.
verses.ct: Moses said, "As soon as I leave you, I will pray to the LORD so that the swarms of flies will leave Pharaoh, his officials, and his people by tomorrow. But Pharaoh must not be deceptive again by refusing to let the people go to sacrifice to the LORD."

verses.kjv: And Moses went out from Pharaoh, and intreated the LORD.
verses.ct: Moses left Pharaoh and prayed to the LORD.

verses.kjv: And the LORD did according to the word of Moses; and he removed the swarms of flies from Pharaoh, from his servants, and from his people; there remained not one.
verses.ct: The LORD did what Moses asked — he removed the swarms of flies from Pharaoh, his officials, and his people. Not a single one remained.

verses.kjv: And Pharaoh hardened his heart at this time also, neither would he let the people go.
verses.ct: But once again Pharaoh hardened his heart and would not let the people go.
